markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Quelaunt](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3159)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

This three-armed, three-legged monster has no discernible eyes, nose, ears, or mouth, and no visible means of ingesting food. Its limbs are distributed so evenly across its body that it's all but impossible to tell which way the creature is oriented at any given time. Few who witness a quelaunt linger on its alien looks for long though, as the invasion of their minds becomes a more pressing concern, sowing doubt, sorrow, and rage. This monstrosity not only delights in the negative emotions of its prey, but feeds on them, gaining strength and sustenance from their dismay. For the quelaunt, no act is too terrible or cruel to inflict on its victims, since the more a creature suffers, the more the quelaunt feasts.

 Quelaunts are known to associate with other aberrant horrors, including [jah-tohls](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2930) and other creatures associated with the [Dominion of the Black](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=394). However, the more prevalent theory paints them as more alien—perhaps invasive beings from another dimension of pure thought and feeling—and claims that in their natural state they have no physical bodies at all. Few dare speculate further; the only known autopsy of a quelaunt resulted in the researcher's suicide just days afterward and all the notes were mysteriously destroyed. Whatever secrets there are to be unlocked in the anatomy of these bizarre monsters are apparently important enough to warrant great protection from quelaunts, even after death.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 34

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Quelaunt.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 15">[Quelaunt](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3159)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Aberration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=523" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 285 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +29; [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=82) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 60 feet

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13); (can't speak any language); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +30, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +27

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +5

**Con** +4

**Int** +5

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +8
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 36 

**Fort** +27 

**Ref** +26 

**Will** +31 (+33 vs. [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590))

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 305

</row>

**Resistances**
[mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647) 15

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet; [_fly_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1534)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+12 slashing

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 39
- **2nd**
[Laughing Fit](/Spells.aspx?ID=1583)
- **3rd**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110) (at will)
- **7th**
[Wave of Despair](/Spells.aspx?ID=1757) (×3)
- **Constant (4th)**
[Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125)

**Emotional Focus**   The quelaunt can cast the following cleric domain spells as 8th-rank occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: [_captivating adoration_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1829), [_delusional pride_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1787), and [_ignite ambition_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1782).

**Emotional Frenzy** <actions string="Three Actions" />  The quelaunt casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.

**Feed on Emotion** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The quelaunt feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that's under a harmful [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) effect. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or take 4d10 mental damage and be [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=93) for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, the quelaunt regains the same number of Hit Points and regains the action it spent to Feed on Emotion. It can't use the regained action to Feed on Emotion again.

**Rapid Strikes** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) The quelaunt makes three melee Strikes, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack but increases only after all the attacks have been made.

**Spiral of Despair** <actions string="Free Action" /> ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) **Trigger** A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt's innate spells or emotional focus spells; **Effect** As the quelaunt invades the triggering creature's mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target's feelings of hope or positivity. The quelaunt can immediately end a single [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590) effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Other Quelaunts</title>

Perhaps the most frightening tales of quelaunts attribute them with abilities beyond those detailed here, suggesting that quelaunts might be an entire category of alien menace that has only recently turned its awful attention to humanity.
</aside>
name: Quelaunt
